item.title: Socialism: Abridged Definition
item.description: Socialism is the transitionary stage between Capitalism, and Communism. Being a transitionary stage, it inherently spans a spectrum of characteristics, being closer towards Capitalism in the earlier stages, and getting progressively closer to Communism as time goes on. The single defining characteristic of Socialism is the inversion of the power dynamic between worker (proletariat) and capitalist (bourgeois). This is defined by Karl Marx as the Dictatorship of the Proletariat, however, dictatorship is being used differently then how you might be used to seeing.
